Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with Reasonable Prices”
Reviews.Author: Joanne L
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in June 2012 in Madrid. The Hotel Mora, although it is an older hotel was clean and comfortable. We especially enjoyed the very inexpensive restaurant and the proximity to the Prado and the Retiro Park.

Reviews.Title: “Muy bien”
Reviews.Author: David N
Reviews.Content: My aunt, who is a World traveler, recommended Hotel Mora, and I stayed there with my daughter during a one day layover en route from Tel Aviv to New York. The hotel was as my aunt said--centrally located, and a very reasonable price for the room, and the staff was very courteous and helpful. The hotel is a block away from El Prado art museum and a few blocks from the train station. I highly recommend staying there. We did not eat the food, except for fresh fruit, as we keep Kosher, but the cafeteria looked nice and clean. They do not have a swimming pool, but we were just there one night, so did not care. We were there in August 2007, but on the website, it only allows you up to one year previous...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: marion00
Reviews.Content: This hotel has received mixed reviews in the past. We stayed there for four nights in May and we really liked it. As other recent reviewers have said, the location is very good if you want to go to the art galleries and use Attocha station. Our room was clean, well furnished and comfortable. We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The air conditioning worked well. We had breakfast in the hotel and it was fine - 2.50 euros for a cafe con leche and toast or croissant. We thought the hotel to be good value for a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: InETn
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this one for value and location. About five blocks from the Atocha Train Station, about 1 block from another separate Atocha metro (and Madrid has a fantastic metro). AND across the street from the Prado, no less. I read where the staff at the desk was unfriendly and unhelpful. They certainly weren't overly friendly, but they were helpful and professional. I read pros and cons about being in the front as well as the back of the hotel, so decided not to ask for either one. Was put in the back and it was very comfortable. Room was fairly large size, air conditioner worked well. Shower was small, but I've seen smaller. Toilet had no leg room so you either had to straddle or sit sideways, and you had to step over it to get to the shower. The little restaurant at the bottom was quite nice when you didn't want to have to wander for food, but there are tons of places all around, and again, the metro gets you anywhere in no time. There is a feria de libros across the street (to the right, sort of), and the beautiful Retiro park is right there as well as the botanical gardens. Bed was comfortable, everything clean, and the price was right. The internet is tricky, but once you get on, it works great, even up in your room and it's free (note to big hotel chains: we the people are tired of paying for internet).

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMaryJ
Reviews.Content: A wonderful spot for the large museums and old town. Be sure to get a room at the back as it is noisy and hot. We were there during a heat wave and they did not turn on the a/c until the last night after we had moved rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for budget travel”
Reviews.Author: Blindbutterfly
Reviews.Content: I selecteed Hotel Mora for their location ( right across from Museo Del Prado and close to Atocha train Station... tehlocation was great however the hotel was not taht greta... there was a smell in the room..and their wi-fi was aweful.... they said they had wi-fi but you coudl never connect....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: yahoodingen
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a good friend for 4 nights. The room was nice, not too small and perfectly laid out. It didn't have a balcony, just a window looking onto the building behind (we asked for a room at the back because of the heavy traffic at the front). The weather was crap anyway, so it didn't matter. The breakfast we had once for convenience. It was cheap and it did the job, but it's not great. Many options down the road. I found the location to be perfect. All good museums very close, Atocha train station 5 minutes away, and since we are young but not *that* young, we wanted to be close to the action, but not in the middle of it, so we could sleep. :-) The staff was friendly, the bathroom very comfortable, the bed was comfortable... just a nice and simple hotel. Perhaps the price could have been a bit lower.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location and the Room was Good”
Reviews.Author: PaleGale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mora in September 2011. Our room was small and utilitarian however it was clean and comfortable. We loved the central location and could easily walk to the Prado (which is absolutely worth a visit). We did have breakfast one day in the little restaurant attached to the hotel but we found better value for money a four minute walk down the street. We were easily able to walk from the hotel to the train station to catch our train to Barcelona. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and we would recommend it for the budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, location and price”
Reviews.Author: Jfduke
Reviews.Content: It is not the first time I stay at this Hotel. Recommendable for its relation quality/location/price. Small rooms but clean and with everything you need: a good bed and a bathroom. Close to Museums.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we stayed for only 1 night”
Reviews.Author: claker1
Reviews.Content: I am not a finicky traveler, I just need clean; quaint is a bonus. We knew this wouldn't be a gem of a hotel as we paid $84 for 1 night, but we needed something close to the Atocha station as well as the museum district. With less than 24 hours in town, we wanted to explore a part of Madrid in a short time. Hotel Moral location allowed for this. Easy 5-10 minute walk to/from the Atocha Renfe station. Had just enough time to do the free evening admission to the Prado. Plaza Santa Ana nearby was a perfect way to end our evening, lively nightlife with multiple great restaurants. The bathroom was clean. Blinds kept out ALL light. However I was scared to sleep in the sheets as there were several pubic hairs on them when I pulled back the comforter. Question if the floor had been vacuumed? Wi-Fi was somewhat of a bear to figure out and had a slow connection. Wouldn't recommend unless you have a similar situation with limited time near the museum district.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, clean, safe, and as central as could be....”
Reviews.Author: Loving-Journeys
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mora for three nights in July upon recommendation from a Madrid friend. Staff was always helpful and mostly very friendly, rooms were nicely appointed in modern decor and clean. The place was an island of peace in the middle of a buzzling downtown. It was the beginning of our first trip to Spain, so we weren't sure what to expect - this place was welcoming and safe. I was impressed with the acoustic insulation: our room looked out over the Paseo del Prado (fabulous view!), which is one of the busiest streets in downtown Madrid. Yet, with the windows and balcony door (!!) closed, it was completely quiet in the room. If you need cool air: the AC worked VERY well. As for the location: can't be closer to the Prado, the Thyssen, and the Reina all at once. The Caixa Forum (exhibits) is right next door. Everything in walking distance. Easy train and subway access. Definitely would come back here/recommed to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back!”
Reviews.Author: Maverick59
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Hotel Mora and they will be our last. Though location is good, the front desk staff was totally uninterested in helping us with questions and seemed put out by our presence. If they don't like their jobs, do something else. Better options and nice accomodations are available close by for only 6 euros more per night.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend!”
Reviews.Author: sseae
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mora from 3/11-3/13. We found the front desk person (male) to be extremely rude. He acted disgusted when we arrived, like we were bothering him. He offered no help in restaurant options, circled a few areas on a map and shoved it at us. The woman on Sunday morning was also rude. Our room was adequate but the triple our children had reaked of mildew and upon leaving our daughter felt the wall and it was actually wet. The location is good and the cafe was OK but I would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful front desk”
Reviews.Author: anon49021
Reviews.Content: Our Spanish is limited, but the front desk was always helpful with suggestions, maps, and willing to make reservations for us. Location was great, and adjacent cafeteria was convenient and pleasant. Double doors to balcony make rooms quiet in spite of busy street.

Reviews.Title: “small, but close to Prado”
Reviews.Author: JoonasH
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to Prado and affordable enough in Madrid, but room was very small (double room for single person) and breakfast not included. The room was clean and there was TV. It was quiet and maybe reasonable price compared to price level in Madrid - but wouldnt recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: e_moorefield
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, our last night in Madrid, after returning from Barcelona and before flying home to the US. The hotel was easy to find, right on the Paseo del Prado, just a couple of blocks from the Prado museum. We arrived in the morning, and were able to store our bags in a cabinet in the lobby while we went sight-seeing. Once we returned in the afternoon and checked in, we went up to our room. It was small, but clean and reasonably comfortable. The bathroom is easily the smallest I've seen outside of a boat, but manageable. We were on the back side of the building, so traffic noise was not a problem. In all, the room did the job we needed it to for the night we were there. I'd certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location: 10 minute walk to any...”
Reviews.Author: randyllwarehime
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: 10 minute walk to any of the big three museums as well as Atocha RR station. Easy to get to from airport via metro. Nice, small, clean rooms. AC, lift, no noise problem whether facing Paseo del Prado or not. All have double windows. Facing the park you have added feature of a Juliette balcony. Staff, especially Guillermo, helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: BerneseMtDog
Reviews.Content: Hotel Mora is located in the middle of all the museums. It has a reasonable size room, free wifi, a nice downstairs coffee shop and restaurant, and new furnishings. Staff was friendly and helpful. The only thing I didn't like was the miniature shower which was the standard, small European shower. AC worked fine during this temperate period but if you like to leave the window open at night, noise is moderate for a city but not totally quiet. All this for 70 Euros including tax.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant; no problems”
Reviews.Author: newyawka2001
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 days. At one point asked to pay in advance but they backed off. Only other "negatives" were not getting to see itemeized bill before paying. Also street a bit quiet, more vibrant a few blocks up. But in general staff extremely nice. I felt at home. Room small but well worth it. Would go back. Was there combining work (research) and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dirty hotel!! Rude stuff!! The blankets had holes and stains!! The bathroom was not cleaned from the previous clients!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location for Museums”
Reviews.Author: rms11
Reviews.Content: This budget hotel was very clean and adequate for a quick two night stay for us to take in the Prado, Sophia, and Fundacion Mapfre art exhibits. No internet except for wi-fi in the lobby if you have a laptop. TV is limited to 7 Spanish speaking stations. Our room (407) at the rear of the hotel was quiet although sounds will travel through the paper thin walls & doors. The hotel has a restaurant on site. We could walk to the Atocha train station and Retiro Park.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Valery R
Reviews.Content: Mora is a nice hotel, located in the very heart of the city, near the Atocha railway station and Prado Museum. Small but nice rooms, convenient location, very good food. A perfect hotel for lower budget travels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Dominey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mora for 2 night weekend city break in Feb 2009. The hotel location is great, opposite the botanical gardens, near the museums, just a short walk from the restaurants & bars of Huertas & Santa Ana and close to the train station. The hotel décor is rather dated, the lobby is very chintzy & clad with marble, the rooms are basic but clean, ours had a good view over the botanical gardens. There was no safe box in the room as advertised and no safe to leave valuables at reception. The rude staff on duty advised us to ‘hide valuables under our bed.’ We found the Front of House staff throughout our stay to be unfriendly, monosyllabic and arrogant. We chose the hotel for its location and value for money but I wouldn’t stay here again, the hotel is pretty characterless and the customer service is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “great location, unfriendly welcome and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: lakm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, but the unfriendliness of the place really put a damper on our experience. The hotel rooms are small, basic and adequate. We didn't sample their restaurant because we had such a negative feeling about the hotel - but there were great tapas places nearby. You are also up the block from the Reina Sophia museum, the Prado and very near the train station and metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly enjoyable and felt like home by the end of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: LonghouseMedia
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived I wasn't really sure about the hotel, especially as the woman at the desk was extremely unfriendly. But when I entered my room I was pleasantly surprised and happy with the simplicity and cleanliness of the space. I dove into the crisp sheets of the bed and slept for the rest of the night. In the morning I woke to a beautiful sky and wonderful view from the balcony and instantly felt comfortable in my little hotel room. My colleague and I stayed for 7 nights and have to say that Hotel Mora felt more and more like home each day. Even the staff seemed to have shed their stoic facade and turned out to be sincere, friendly and very helpful. (they each speak 3-5 languages BTW) With out a doubt I would recommend this hotel to other travelers and will plan to stay here for my next trip to Spain. One thing to note for business travelers is that the wifi access is only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: c-rita
Reviews.Content: We were 5 girls visiting madrid on vacation. A friend of us recommended the Hotel, it was a good choice. 3 stars hotel great location, near Atocha station, museo del prado, thyssen and Sta Sophia art museum. Rooms are clean and comfortable, staff not really smiley faces, but helpful. the rooms have double balcony doors; the interior door is double glazed, what mean u wouldn't hear road traffic noises. You can use the airport shuttle on ur way back to the airport but u have to reserve 24 hours before.

Reviews.Title: “Great, reasonably priced hotel in Art Triangle.”
Reviews.Author: Edrsa
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room (double occupancy) for 5 nights. First night in room above cafe - very noisy, avoid room 101. Moved to room 307 on request - marvellous, quiet with enough space for 2. Reasonably priced. Within easy walking distance of the three art museums and Atocha station. Staff are not the friendliest but efficient and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Polly76
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and I would say we were both reasonably satisfied ( and my Wife is fussy where hotels are concerned ). The location is good, being close to the prado and other museums although Madrid centre is relatively small for a City and most places are walkable. The Mora is situated on a fairly busy road but the double windows ensure you get peace and quiet at night. The rooms are clean and comfortable although not luxurious, but perfectly ok for a short stay in Madrid. Our room was very small but again for a short stay this was'nt a problem, I believe the front facing rooms are slightly bigger. One slight grumble was that the bed was very hard, I prefer firm beds but even for me this was a bit too much but it seems this is pretty much the case throughout Madrid. For me the reception staff were helpful and polite, I did not experience any of the rudeness mentoned in other reviews. All of the staff I encountered also spoke English. One final thing, the adjoining cafe/restaurant was very good for both breakfast and lunch. On our final day I had a Paella starter and Fish Main for just under 10 Euros, good quality and good value, it was always frequented by locals as well which is a good sign. The staff in the cafe didnt speak much English though, so you may need to brush up on your basic Spanish. All in all, not the best hotel I have ever stayed in but perfectly adequate for a short city break and at 83 euros per night fair value.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, clean”
Reviews.Author: slink59
Reviews.Content: For our short trip, focused on time in three of Madrid's great museums, Hotel Mora was a perfect homebase. The location was perfect -- right across the street from the Prado, and just blocks from the Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza and the Reina Sofia, but also close to lots of cafes and bars, near the train station for a day trip to Segovia, and reasonable walking distance to Chueca, Gran Via, and the Plaza Mayor. Our room was clean and comfortable, with a large, light bathroom. It was all much better than I'd expected for the price. If we come back to Madrid, we'll come back to Hotel Mora.

Reviews.Title: “Location perfect, minutes from the Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen Bornemisza, El Retiro park, metro and little restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: artistfrommalvern
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Mora for 4 nights and found it excellent - our room was spacious with a very large bathroom, very clean and comfortable, with a view out to Paseo del Prado. The cafe was convenient and good for breakfasts. We came to see the Prado and the other important art galleries in Madrid and everything is so near that it made for a very stress free stay. The little streets behind the hotel are full of interesting little cafes and restaurants, and places like the Royal Palace are only a half an hour's walk at the most. The Botanical Gardens are just opposite and we spent our last morning in the nearby El Retiro Park where we saw a magical exhibition in the magical Crystal Palace. A fabulous stay, we shall return again to Madrid and to this hotel where the service was always friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Don´t try your luck: unfriendly staff, huge room standard differences”
Reviews.Author: babet09
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the Hotel Mora, with a booking of several weeks in advance. I travel a lot, but this is my own personal hotel low. I can see however, how different travellers have rated the Mora so differently -- read on: I staid one night alone, then with my partner for three more nights. I was more or less forced to book a double room for the first night as well -- they just refused to give me a single room with any conveniences. I did not mind so much expecting a more comfortable stay, so I moved in. The "double" room I was given was extremely small and the bathroom smelled of foul water. I was in a newly renovated section of the hotel (1st floor), so I assume that the repairs had gone badly. I did everything I could to get the smell out with no help from the staff, but it was too strong and as I woke up repeatedly because of it I asked for a change. I got it. The second room was about twice the size, odourless and overall much much nicer. When my partner arrived, things started all over again. We were told that we could not stay in the second room, but had to move back to the first one. Of course we refused -- I could smell the foul water even from the hallway, so it was obvious nobody from the reception cared. I never heard a word of regret, it was as if the fact that the hotel could not provide us with a usable room was our problem. We had never intended to spend our few days in Madrid hotel-hunting, but it got worse every day. Finally, we were just tired of fighting the reception hazard every day, and started looking for another hotel. We found a free room right at Atocha. The moment we got back to Mora to check out, they changed their course. My partner was finally told they were "sorry" (a luxury I never enjoyed) and figuring we would rather spend our last day in Madrid enjoying the city instead of moving to another hotel, we spent also our last night there. I can only say: I should have followed my first instinct and just moved on. Spending your time at a place like this is just not worth your time and money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Vacation at the Hotel Mora”
Reviews.Author: newyorkatocha
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a delightful 5 night stay at the Hotel Mora in Madrid. My wife, 16 year old daughter and I all found our stay to be quite satisfactory. We paid 96 Euros a night (with tax) and had a triple room. It was very adequate...clean and quiet, even though the room faced the Paseo del Prado...but then again this was late November so the traffic and street activity was down a bit. The staff was helpful. The attached restaurant was a good place to get hot chocolate and churros each morning before setting out. The hotel was close to the museums and the Atocha train station. A 30 minute walk could take you to most Madrid locations. I would strongly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A real gem for the budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: sun&oil
Reviews.Content: At the time that we made our reservations the Hotel Mora did not have a secure website with which I felt comfortable sending my cc#. So I communicated with the manager by e-mail and he allowed us to make a reservation. Later I tried to reconfirm by telephone and give them my cc#, but I was told my reservation was confirmed. Our flight from Tenerife was delayed and we arrived at 2AM. The hotel had saved us a room. The room was clean and quite, but small. The bathroom was very small. Eventually we figured out that what looked like a glass wall actually had a hinge and that made it easier to get in and out of the shower. Prior to discovering this, we had squeezed into the shower between the glass wall and the sink. We stayed 3 nights and left at 4:30AM on Monday morning. The hotel had a taxi ready to take us to the airport for our flight to Amsterdam. The location is fantastic!!! Midway between the Prado and the Reina Sofia and across the street from the Botanical Garden. Directly, behind the hotel is a new cultural cente that recently opened: the Caxia Forum. They had a fantastic collection from the Uffizi Gallery that was free. They also had several concerts for adults and families. When we were there concerts were only 10 euros. Lectures were 2 euros. Additionally adjacent to the hotel and next to the Caxia Forum is a living wall. The wall had been highlighted in the airline magazine that we had read on our way from Tenerife. Imagine our delight when we discovered the wall with all of its living plants. We were close to the Madrid Vision city bus tours, the beautiful train station, and so much more. A variety of restaurants in all price ranges were near-by. The hotel is a gem and a real bargin for the budget traveler in the mueum district.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: brokernu2
Reviews.Content: We used the hotel as our base to visit many attractions through-out the city. The desk clerks were very helpful in giving directions and helped with transportation needs. Spoke good english. Located very close to the metro subway system, as well as major museums. We were able to get a corner room that had great views and was large compared to most european rooms. We would stay here again if visiting Madrid, great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Staff and Awful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: tennisgirlUsa
Reviews.Content: This hotel can not be beat for its central location amongst the Prado, Reina Sophia, and Thyssen but in terms of amenities it is bare bones (which we expected). But the bathroom ceiling with starting to rot and overall the room was old, tired, and dated. We were given towels that were ripped like rags. Overall it verged on the edge of disgusting. The staff is so rude and did not offer to lift one finger to help us with anything during our stay(save for one guy on the late night/early morning shift). My strongest recommendation is don't do it. I think there are many other hotels located just as close.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KMartin212
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Mora for two nights, April 12 and 13. It is a nice budget hotel right across the street from the Prado and close to Parque del Buen Retiro. The single room was clean, and the bathroom small but fine for one person. The bed was on the firm side but that's my preference. The best thing was I had a small balcony and loved watching the crowds walk up on down the Paseo del Prado. It's also very close to Atocha station where you can catch the Metro or RENFE. Quiet at night. And the price was very good at 60 euros (VAT included).

Reviews.Title: “smells”
Reviews.Author: cappucinos
Reviews.Content: I book a single room for 1 night. The room smelled of cigarette smoke and the window had to be opened to rid of the smell. Don't turn on the air conditioner because it made it worse. The bathroom was small but functional. The location is its greatest asset. Very close to the 3 main art museums.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Madrid center”
Reviews.Author: mistok
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in the very center of Madrid, five minutes walk from Prado Museum and very close to the main attrctions of this fantastic city. Rooms are quite small and no breakfast is given, but the price over quality ratio is very good: hotel is quite chip for all that offers. If you are looking for a central hotel at very cheap prices Mora is what you need

Reviews.Title: “Good deal at the Mora”
Reviews.Author: xyztravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mora for three nights in mid-September. Our room was small, but seemed newly refurbished and was completely passable. (We were on the third floor; the first and second looked slightly older). In the 10 days we spent roaming around Spain this was by far the quietest room we had, and that's saying something since our window looked out over a construction site. The double windows effectively muffled any sound from below, which was great. The location was fine—a 5 minute walk from the train station and the Prado and Botanical gardens. If we had to do it again, we might have tried to find a hotel closer to Plaza Mayor or Plaza Santa Ana, but we were more than happy to be slightly farther away considering the price we got for the room. There is a restaurant attached to the Mora that seemed to be popular for breakfast, but we never ate there. If you walk up the street you'll find a place called Frappeti, which had good coffee and pastries. Note: If you're leaving from Mora to go to the airport, inquire about the airport shuttle. It was 20 euros for the two of us, cheaper than a taxi, and got us to the airport in about 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Much less than impressed”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Mora for the last two nights of our honeymoon. We were not expecting luxury accomodations, and knew the rooms would be basic. However, the hotel advertises that some rooms overlook the botanical gardens. It should be noted that the botanical gardens are across the street, so even though our room technically "overlooked" them, this was a huge stretch (we really just had a view of the busy street below). In reality the room was okay, but unless you are a smoker we don't recommend staying here. The smell of cigarette smoke permeated our room throughout our stay, no matter how many times we opened the screen door or window. The staff was not unfriendly, but not particularly helpful either. If none of these things bother you, the price was affordable and it was a good location for going to the museums-- and very close to the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Mora is the place for me!!”
Reviews.Author: WilliamEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Mora for three nights way back in 2002 and I had such a positive experience then, I had no hesitation in booking for three nights in May this year. For starters, you can't beat the location!! Slap bang on the lovely Paceo del Prado (literally a 5 minute walk from Atocha Renfe train station and a further 15 minute walk to Puerta del Sol). Mora is almost directly across from the Prado museum, 5 minutes away from the Museo Nacional Reina Sofía and a further 10 minute walk from Retiro Park (you must go here)!!! I woke up every morning, opened my curtains and stepped onto the balcony that overlooked the tree lined, bustling Paceo del Prado........Fantastico!!!! Ok.....it can be a noisy street but the windows are soundproofed and you can't really hear the traffic at all during the night. My room (301) was spotless and I think it had been recently renovated as it still smelt fresh. The air con worked fine, the bathroom was very clean and the shower was in perfect working order! Rooms are cleaned every morning and you can obtain the safe key from reception. The staff (as always) were very polite, patient, helpful and spoke perfect English. Special thanks to Sonia!! The quickest and easiest way to reach to hotel from Barajas airport terminal 2: Take Metro line 8 (pink) to Nuevos Ministerios. Here you catch a RENFE train (not a metro) to Atocha Renfe train staion (almost same price as Metro ticket). A quick walk up the Paseo del Prado and hey presto!!! For trips to other parts of Madrid, the nearest Metro station is Atocha, which is situated across from Atocha Renfe train station and is really easy to find. I paid 60 euros per night for my double room (breakfast not included) and it was worth every penny. The hotel food is also pretty good, although I never ate there this time) and the restaurant is always full of locals (a good sign if you ask me). I've already booked here again for when I return to Madrid in September. If you know of anywhere better in this area for this price....then please let me know!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for value and location”
Reviews.Author: tropicalia
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Hotel Mora becaue of it (1) location (2) availabilty. Upon checking in they had our reservation for the following day. After pleading and prodding for a room, (we speak fluent Spanish) one materialized but "it would not be ready until 3:00pm". This was at 10:00 am. They do provide locked storage for your bags. I left my husband with a bad cold in the lobby and tried to find another room at nearby hotels with no luck. The front desk gal eventually warmed up to us and did get us a room shortly. After that, she was friendly. The room was small, and yes, it faced the construction site, but it was totally refurbished including double paned windows--no noise at all. The room and bath was modern, clean and functional. No toiletries except soap bars. The lobby has not been refurbished like the rooms. The coffee shop is again, functional and open all day. But the location is ideal for art lovers. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “at least is clean”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had one day stay at the Mora and I have to say the room was lovely and clean (without shower gel in the bath) but the staff were not so friendly and not helpful at all. Looks like you have to beg them to do something for you and when I left the hotel they didnt even call me a taxi they told me to wait in the street to wait for one to come so just one commentary..........................At least was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Born_yesterday
Reviews.Content: This is a decent hotel for the price and the location is excellent: it's right in front of the Museo del Prado and it is minutes away from a major train station and city metro. You can also walk to many of the city's attractions. The lobby area is nice and the staff is friendly. Our room was not exceedingly spacious but it was big enough for my wife and me. The room was very clean, well-kept, and the furnishings were relatively new. They had recently renovated the bathroom. I would not hesitate to stay there again on my next trip to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Has to be my worst experience with hotels. Booked to stay there for 4 nights last week. Location looked to be perfect from guide books because of its proximity to the museums and to Atocha station (we came in overnight from Barcelona) but with hindsight I would think that hotels around the Playa Major and Playa Santa Anna are better located. Yes the hotel is close to the museums but then it is far away from much of the nightlife eating/drinking. Anyway there are extensive building works going on outside of the hotel. The whole block next to and behind the hotel was demolished and large construction machines were in operation throughout the day. On top of this they were carrying out renovations to the interior of the hotel at the same time. We were given no advance warning of this and there was only a small sign in reception apologizing for the disruption caused. However the constant hammering and drilling continued from 9am to 6pm without breaks. On checking in we were allocated a small room at the back of the hotel with a view of a building site - this was despite having paid the highest room tariff and it was then that we could hear the banging going on in the room directly above. We went to the reception and asked if they had any other rooms (the rooms at the front at least have a view (even if it is of one of Madrids busiest highways). The staff were completely unsympathetic and said they had no other rooms available despite the fact that it was 1pm, we had booked 3 months in advance and we must have been one of the first people to check in that day. When we told them that this was not satisfactory they told us fine - go check into the Hotel Mexicana around the corner. My fiancee was livid so went in search of alternative accomodation. She found an extremely nice hostal where the staff were friendly and polite, the rooms had daylight and were bigger and more comfortable than the rooms at the Mora. The price was also 20€ less per night. We were committed to staying the one night so the next morning we checked out and my fiancee paid with her credit card. The woman on reception was helpful but she forgot to return the card and at the same time we both did not notice until later that night when we went to pay for a meal with the card. We returned to the hotel where we knew the card had to be only for the guy on reception to tell us that the hotel did not have the card, that he would have a note if they did and that we should come back tomorrow. We phoned the bank back home and they confirmed that the last transaction was with the hotel but as we no longer had the card they deactivated it. So in the morning we returned to the hotel and the woman who had forgotten to return the card was on the desk and apologised and pulled the card out from below the desk in a secure box. She could not explain why her colleague had refused to look for the card as it was immediately below where he had been sat and it was normal procedure. She had also left him a note. The hotel is just not up to the standard you would expect, hostals in the city have the same amenities only nicer rooms and nicer staff. Even the Time Out guide says of this hotel "the rooms and the hotel have recently been renovated, shame the same could not be said of the staff".

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: dregnichols
Reviews.Content: We had a very fine stay at the Mora. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room clean and comfortable, and the view from the balcony first rate. The location and quality can't be beat for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable”
Reviews.Author: DenverPete
Reviews.Content: Unreliable. We stayed there once, thought the location was good, and that the hotel was comfortable. As we were planning to come back to Madrid about two months later with another couple, we made the reservations right there with the front desk clerk (watched him fill out the paperwork). When we got to Madrid on the next trip we found we had no place to stay. Hotel Mora had somehow managed to lose the reservation, and had filled all their rooms. Rather than trying to help provide a solution, they just made excuses. Fortunately we found a room in another hotel across from the train station. We have been to Madrid many times at the city has too many good, reliable hotels to waste your time on a place like Hotel Mora.

Reviews.Title: “small but practical and convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: the rooms are tiny compared to american standard but clean. This hotel is very inexpensive and very convenient to all the historical monuments. Walking distance from Plaza Mayor, Prado Museum, and the tapas bars and clubs. I recommend it for the practical traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Popular bargain choice”
Reviews.Author: dlrold
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times over the last three years. Perfectly situated across the street from both the Prado and Reina Sofia museums and steps away from bus and metro lines, as well as the Atocha railroad station. Though it was cheaper prior to the Euro a standard double is still only $69 (no breakfast, though there is an adjoining cafe). Rooms are small and sparsely furnished but the hotel is well run and very clean. I would recommend asking for a room above the second floor as, recently, I was kept awake by the flushing of water through pipes in the walls (which is louder on the lower floors). I've recommended the hotel to many and all have had positive experiences.
